comments.body: Is this used any other way than `_ => false` or `_=> true` ? It could just be a flag then
The `filter: String => Boolean` parameter is identical to the `checkEditLine` method.

comments.body: we generally use short meaningful names for the tests (e.g. `exhaustive-sorting`), so that they can be used as targets for `testOnly`.
Can we add another cross test case for 3rd party defined symbols? Cross tests have the ability to index library dependencies, see `indexScalaLibrary()`
Yay, really excited to finally get the `Some` case at the top
I don't think we need the else here? `!isScala211` is already tested at the top
Oops, we don't need it. I meant like this https://github.com/scalameta/metals/pull/1174/commits/0d5f96fb977b6c73c44b8b5c061480393ecb1c82, thank you for pointing it out :)
this test passes because it fails ðŸ™ƒ

here's an example. You could technically also do 

```suggestion
    "exhaustive-fully-qualify".tag(Tag.ExpectedFailure),
```

but since we'll reasonably have a few tags, I opted for a utility "DSL" method
I think it's fine to have a method here to ease discovery.

Could we maybe add a test also with `def testExhaustive[T <: TestA](test: T): Boolean =`

To be sure it works without refinement too?
